descriptionHtml:
[center][IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v233/Adolon/dwptitle_zpsd2b24379.png[/IMG]

[b]Runner-Up in the Dragonborn Mod Contest hosted by the Skyrim Creation Kit Steam group![/b]

[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v233/Adolon/dwpquestsummary_zps0c311ab5.png[/IMG][/center]
Satar-Dan is a very angry Dark Elf living by the shores of Tel Mithryn with the ghosts of his dead ancestors. Who wouldn't be angry living next to a wizard with his bumbling apprentices? If you pester him enough, he might just give you something in an effort to persuade you to leave him be. Perhaps something Dwarven.

[center][IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v233/Adolon/dwpcontents_zps54941b68.png[/IMG][/center]
This quest mod has a fully voiced character. You can find him and his house below the cliff at Tel Mithryn. The quest will have you journeying deep under the ruins of Nchardak to a Dwarven prison complex and laboratory. The magic effects of the weapon you find are not final. I'm still trying to figure out a script that will suit it.

[list][*]An estimated 1- to 2-hour long lore-friendly quest
[*]A new series of Dwemer ruins to explore
[*]A fully-voiced character
[*]A new one-handed dagger with unique enchantment
[*]4,000 NavMesh triangles!
[*]Ghosts!
[*]Easter eggs![/list]

[center][IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v233/Adolon/dwpcompatibility_zpsc4117033.png[/IMG][/center]
This mod might become or be incompatible with mods that change the landscape or add things to the base of [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Dragonborn:Tel_Mithryn_%28settlement%29]Tel Mithryn[/url] and [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Dragonborn:Nchardak]Nchardak[/url]. Specifically, cells [code](17,5)[/code], [code](19,5)[/code], [code](19,7)[/code], and [code](20,10)[/code] to [code](21,9)[/code]. Errors such as [url=http://www.creationkit.com/Floating_Grass_Fix]floating grass[/url], landscapes with incorrect textures, and missing or duplicated static meshes may occur.

[center][IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v233/Adolon/dwpbugsandissues_zps668e0cb5.png[/IMG][/center]
-The NavMesh bug. If you do not have Skyrim version [code]1.6.89.0.6[/code] or above, the infamous NavMesh bug will rear its ugly head. There is no fix for this aside from a version update or tediously reloading the game every few cell transitions.
-Non-standard NPC skin texture colors are used in this mod. If you do not have Skyrim version [code]1.4.27.0.4[/code] or above, texture errors may occur. There is no fix for this aside from a version update. This is a problem with Skyrim, not the Creation Kit.
-Ambushes may not work correctly in that enemies will stand outside their hiding place.
-I have tried my best to alleviate lag and increase performance in the Tonal Oubliette area. If a lot of people are suffering because of it, I may go back to the drawing board for that location.

[center][IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v233/Adolon/dwpextras_zps6a1c7f77.png[/IMG][/center]
A German translation by [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/4864937-gunter525]Gunter525[/url]: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/43468/]Deutsch[/url]

Mods by me:
[list][*][url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5398]Books Books Books[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25057]Kind of Blue[/url][/list]

Mods by Anuiel:
[list][*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30062]Dwemer Beards[/url][/list]
author: Adolon
